# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description
I followed the Angular Getting Started tutorial on StackBlitz, and it went well until I got to the Deployment section and had to download my code locally to build it for deployment.

After downloading my code, I ran `npm install` and then `npm audit fix` because there was a critical security bug. I then spent the next two hours resolving peer dependency conflicts by upgrading all the packages to their latest versions, and then downgrading a couple that were too new for peer dependencies.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/start

### Reproduction Steps**
1. Open the [StackBlitz Angular Example app](https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/getting-started-v0/stackblitz.html) that's referenced [here](https://angular.io/start#create-a-new-project).
1. Click the download button below the Share button.
1. Extract the downloaded zip archive
1. Open the extracted folder in your terminal app
1. Run `npm install`
1. Run `npm audit fix`
1. Run `npm run build`

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
I expect the build to pass, but it fails due to a missing Build class.

## üåç  Your Environment
Windows 10 Home v1903
Windows Susbsystem for Linux running Ubuntu v18.04.3 LTS
Node v10.16.3
npm v6.9.0

### Anything else relevant?
I have my code on github here: https://github.com/carlin-q-scott/angular-kvsbvb

Issues.Body:

This is necessary because we don't run this test on CI currently, but if we run

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): avoid unnecessary i18n instructions generation for <ng-template> with structural directives
Issues.Body:
If an <ng-template> contains a structural directive (for example *ngIf), Ngtsc generates extra template function with 1 template instruction call. When <ng-template> tag also contains i18n attribute on it, we generate i18nStart and i18nEnd instructions around it, which is unnecessary and breaking runtime. This commit adds a logic to make sure we do not generate i18n instructions in case only `template` is present.

This PR resolves FW-1553.

## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
@angular/platform-browser/testing

### Is this a regression?
No

### Description
Compare two maps for equality in tests. 
expect(map1).toEqual(map2);

- What was the result?
The two maps do not pass the test if key type is not a basic type.

Reasoning: 
Map looks up values by key-reference rather than key equality, this makes the custom equality tester added to jasmine here (https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/platform-browser/testing/src/matchers.ts#L134) to fail. Notice the expected.get() call in line 138).
The extra tester was added since Jasmine did not support Maps. We are now using Jasmine 3.x which has the requisite support.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove jasmine custom equality tester in matchers.ts" (#32620)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): correctly read static properties for aliased classes
Issues.Body:
In ESM2015 bundles, a class with decorators may be emitted as follows:

```javascript
var MyClass_1;
let MyClass = MyClass_1 = class MyClass {};
MyClass.decorators = [/* here be decorators */];
```

Such a class has two declarations: the publicly visible `let MyClass`
and the implementation `class MyClass {}` node. In #32539 a refactoring
took place to handle such classes more consistently, however the logic
to find static properties was mistakenly kept identical to its broken
state before the refactor, by looking for static properties on the
implementation symbol (the one for `class MyClass {}`) whereas the
static properties need to be obtained from the symbol corresponding with
the `let MyClass` declaration, as that is where the `decorators`
property is assigned to in the example above.

This commit fixes the behavior by looking for static properties on the
public declaration symbol. This fixes an issue where decorators were not
found for classes that do in fact have decorators, therefore preventing
the classes from being compiled for Ivy.

Fixes #31791
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(ngcc): correctly read static properties for aliased classes" (#32619)

Issues.Title: build: remove localize as a CODEOWNERS entry
Issues.Body:

Issues.Title: ci: pin docker images by ID for hermeticity
Issues.Body:
Previously, the docker images used on CI where specified by a tag (`10.16` and `10.16-browsers`). Since tags are not immutable, this only pins specific characteristics of the environment (e.g. the OS type and the Node.js version), but not others. Especially when using a tag that does not specify the patch version (e.g. `10.16` instead of `10.16.0`), it is inevitable that the image will change at some point, potentially leading to unrelated failures due to changes in the environment.

One source of such failures can be the Chrome version used in tests. Since we install a specific ChromeDriver version (that is only compatible with specific Chrome version ranges), unexpectedly updating to a newer Chrome version may break the tests if the new version falls outside the range of supported version for our pinned ChromeDriver.

Using a tag that specifies the patch version (e.g. `10.16.0`) or even the OS version (e.g. `10.16.0-buster`) is safer (i.e. has a lower probability of introducing the kind of breakages described above), but is still not fully hermetic.

This commit prevents such breakages by pinning the docker images by ID. Image IDs are based on the image's digest (SHA256) and are thus immutable, ensuring that all CI jobs will be running on the exact same image.

See [here][1] for more info on pre-built CircleCI docker images and more specifically [pinning images by ID][2].

[1]: https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/circleci-images
[2]: https://circleci.com/docs/2.0/circleci-images#using-a-docker-image-id-to-pin-an-image-to-a-fixed-version
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "ci: pin docker images by ID for hermeticity" (#32602)

Issues.Title: @ngtools/webpack hijacks unrelated imports when Ivy is enabled
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
```@ngtools/webpack```

### Description
With Ivy enabled, ngtools/webpack will force itself onto every possible `import` statement, Typescript or not.

E.g.

```
import 'vendor/fontawesome-pro/fontawesome.scss'
```

leads to:

```
ERROR in Error: ENOTDIR: not a directory, stat 'app/vendor/fontawesome-pro/fontawesome.scss/package.json'
    at Object.statSync (fs.js:898:3)
    at Object.statSync (app/node_modules/graceful-fs/polyfills.js:308:16)
    at Storage.provideSync (app/node_modules/enhanced-resolve/lib/CachedInputFileSystem.js:98:13)
    at CachedInputFileSystem.statSync (app/node_modules/enhanced-resolve/lib/CachedInputFileSystem.js:251:28)
    at Observable._subscribe (app/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/webpack-input-host.js:70:52)
    at Observable._trySubscribe (app/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/node_modules/rxjs/internal/Observable.js:43:25)
    at Observable.subscribe (app/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/node_modules/rxjs/internal/Observable.js:29:22)
    at MapOperator.call (app/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/node_modules/rxjs/internal/operators/map.js:29:23)
    at Observable.subscribe (app/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/node_modules/rxjs/internal/Observable.js:24:22)
    at SyncDelegateHost._doSyncCall (app/node_modules/@angular-devkit/core/src/virtual-fs/host/sync.js:22:20)
    at SyncDelegateHost.exists (app/node_modules/@angular-devkit/core/src/virtual-fs/host/sync.js:61:21)
    at WebpackCompilerHost.fileExists (app/node_modules/@ngtools/webpack/src/compiler_host.js:195:44)
    at GeneratedShimsHostWrapper.fileExists (app/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/shims/src/host.js:72:34)
    at TypeCheckProgramHost.fileExists (app/node_modules/@angular/compiler-cli/src/ngtsc/typecheck/src/host.js:64:62)
    at getPackageJsonInfo (app/node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:27259:37)
    at loadNodeModuleFromDirectory (app/node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:27250:49)

Issues.Title: feat(bazel): support ts_library targets as entry-points for ng_package
Issues.Body:
Within an Angular package, it can happen that there are
entry-points which do not contain features that belong into
an `@NgModule` or need metadata files to be generated.

For example: the `cdk`, `cdk/testing` and `cdk/coercion`
entry-points. Besides other entry-points in the `cdk`
package, those entry-points do not need metadata to
be generated and no not use the `ng_module` rule.

Currently the "ng_package" rule properly picks up such
entry-points and builds bundles, does downleveling etc.
The only thing it misses is that no `package.json` files
are generated for the entry-point. This means that consumers
will not be able to use these entry-points built with "ts_library"
(except accessing the individual bundlings explicitly).

The "ng_package" rule should follow the full APF specification
for such entry-points. Partially building bundles and doing the
downleveling is confusing and a breaking issue.

---

The motifivation of supporting this (besides making the
rule behavior consistent; the incomplete output is not
acceptable), is that using the "ng_module" rule does
not make sense to be used for non-Angular entry-points.

Especially since it depends on Angular packages to
be specified as Bazel action inputs just to compile
vanilla TypeScript with `@angular/compiler-cli`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(bazel): support ts_library targets as entry-points for ng_package" (#32610)

Issues.Title: perf(ivy): initialise TNode inputs / outputs on the first creation pass
Issues.Body:
This perf-focused refactoring moves the TNode's input / output initialization
logic to the first template pass - close to the place where directives are
matched and resolved.

This code change makes it possible to update-mode checks for both property
bindings and listeners registration.

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

# üêû bug report

### Affected Package

@angular/bazel

<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->

### Is this a regression?

No

<!-- Did this behavior use to work in the previous version? -->


### Description

The `ng_package` rule does not work on Windows if there are too many rollup
globals. This is because the rollup globals are passed to `rollup` through command
line arguments. This is problematic as on windows the command line argument
is very low and some globals/arguments might be omitted.

Depending on what flags are getting through and the amount of characters which
are accidentally omitted from the arguments, this can either cause an exception to
be thrown, or a successful build which misses some flags or globals.

**Anything else relevant?**

Similar to https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1120. I just submitted this here as well because the `ng_package` rule launches the rollup binary on its own.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bazel: ng_package rule not working with too much rollup globals on windows" (#32603)

Issues.Title: Intercept and cancel the client side call of ‚ÄúenableProdMode()‚Äù function
Issues.Body:
Dears,

To enable the production mode the application should call the "enableProdMode()" function in main.ts . The issue is that the generated js will contain the method without renaming, so the attacker can intercept and cancel the function call then the debug mode will be enabled.

One of the solutions used (even used in [angular.io](https://angular.io) site) is to use webpack as webpack tries to reduce the size of bundled JavaScript files by renaming functions with random short names. Now the function renamed successfully but also the generated js will contain a hint to know where's the function place and also intercept and cancel it, the webpack always replace enableProdMode() with something like this:

`function Oa(){if(ib)throw Error("Cannot enable prod mode after platform setup.");ge=!1}
` 

So the attacked can search for the string "Cannot enable prod mode after platform setup" or part of it and change the function before the browser receives it.

Kindly find the related link that show how to simulate this case: https://nvisium.com/blog/2019/01/17/angular-for-pentesters-part-2.html

Any suggestions for this issue, because it was reported by the security team as a vulnerability ?

Version used is **8.2.4**
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Intercept and cancel the client side call of ‚ÄúenableProdMode()‚Äù function" (#32601)

| [sass](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass) | dependencies | patch | [`1.22.10` -> `1.22.12`](https://renovatebot.com/diffs/npm/sass/1.22.10/1.22.12) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>sass/dart-sass</summary>

### [`v1.22.12`](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​12212)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/sass/dart-sass/compare/1.22.10...1.22.12)

-   **Potentially breaking bug fix:** character sequences consisting of two or
    more hyphens followed by a number (such as `--123`), or two or more hyphens on
    their own (such as `--`), are now parsed as identifiers [in accordance with
    the CSS spec][ident-token-diagram].

    [ident-token-diagram]: <https://drafts.csswg.org/css-syntax-3/#ident-token-diagram>

    The sequence `--` was previously parsed as multiple applications of the `-`
    operator. Since this is unlikely to be used intentionally in practice, we
    consider this bug fix safe.

##### Command-Line Interface

-   Fix a bug where changes in `.css` files would be ignored in `--watch` mode.

##### JavaScript API

-   Allow underscore-separated custom functions to be defined.

-   Improve the performance of Node.js compilation involving many `@import`s.

</details>

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>fabiosantoscode/terser</summary>

### [`v4.3.1`](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v431)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser/compare/v4.3.0...v4.3.1)

-   Fixed an issue from 4.3.0 where any block scope within a for loop erroneously had its parent set to the function scopee
-   Fixed an issue where compressing IIFEs with argument expansions would result in some parameters becoming undefined
-   addEventListener options argument's properties are now part of the DOM properties list.

### [`v4.3.0`](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#v430)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/fabiosantoscode/terser/compare/v4.2.1...v4.3.0)

-   Do not drop computed object keys with side effects
-   Functions passed to other functions in calls are now wrapped in parentheses by default, which speeds up loading most modules
-   Objects with computed properties are now less likely to be hoisted
-   Speed and memory efficiency optimizations
-   Fixed scoping issues with `try` and `switch`

</details>

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fully optimize script bundles with bundle downleveling
Issues.Body:
Script bundles were not being subject to the terser mangle optimizations when using bundle down leveling.
This change also allows terser to perform ECMA 6 level compress and output optimizations on the actual application bundles (non-script bundles) which can provide for further size improvements.  Also limits the parsing for optimizations of the script bundles to one step.

Fixes #15489
Supersedes #15507
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): fully optimize script bundles with bundle downleveling" (#15566)

Issues.Title: Registering lazy routes (dynamic import) at runtime
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
```
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
With the [string loadChildren syntax deprecated](https://angular.io/api/router/DeprecatedLoadChildren) in Angular 8, in favor of the [dynamic import syntax](https://angular.io/api/router/LoadChildrenCallback), it seems it will no longer be possible to register lazy routes at runtime.

Please note that by adding lazy routes at runtime, I'm not referring to loading modules completely unknown to Webpack. These modules would be part of libs that are compiled together with the application, so the chunks would be known to Webpack, but routes would only be added to the router config as a result of a Web API call.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Basically, I'd like to be able to do the following (from a component or e.g. a ngrx effect), and successfully navigate to the new route and its children, while using JIT, AOT and with Ivy (AOT):

```javascript
this._router.config.unshift({
  path: 'dynamic',
  loadChildren: () => import(modulePathReceivedFromServer).then(m => m[moduleNameReceivedFromServer])
});
this._router.resetConfig(this._router.config);
```

With dynamic imports working this way, one could also easily load lazy modules on demand/without routing to them (currently possible with the [deprecated SystemJsNgModuleLoader](https://angular.io/api/core/SystemJsNgModuleLoader)).

### Describe alternatives you've considered
The only alternative I can think of is a Webpack plugin doing something similar to what the `AngularCompilerPlugin` does in `contextModuleFactory.afterResolve`.
You can see my detailed analysis, with a simple demo app and the solutions I could think of here: https://github.com/mbinic/dynamic-lazy-routes#dynamic-lazy-routes-experiment. The last few commits show the code using JIT, AOT and Ivy (AOT), route adding code being almost identical for all cases.

Constructive criticism from the experts is the best way to learn, so I'd love to get your input even if you think this is a bad idea or just plain nonsense. And I'd gladly make a PR if this is something you'd support, to angular-cli and webpack :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Registering lazy routes (dynamic import) at runtime" (#15556)

Issues.Title: support option passthrough (additionalProperties) in schematics and builders
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [x] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
I want to create schematics and builders that support options not explicitly defined in the schema.  

For example, I want to create a builder that spawns a command just passing through the options from the cli. Pretty much like the [example](https://angular.io/guide/cli-builder#schedule-and-run) in angular.io website although instead of defining `command` and `args` options I'd like the user to type (or define in a target) the options as she or he were executing the command directly. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
According to json-schema's draft, [it is possible](https://json-schema.org/understanding-json-schema/reference/object.html#pattern-properties) to combine `properties`, `propertiesPatterns` and `additionalProperties` to define a schema that allows any property and even control the allowed types.

Currently, the cli only considers `boolean` as the possible type of the property `additionalProperties`. 

https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/fe8666073b4f357d4614bf90ac39225980ebe24c/packages/angular/cli/models/architect-command.ts#L244

I'd suggest to make changes in https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/fe8666073b4f357d4614bf90ac39225980ebe24c/packages/angular/cli/utilities/json-schema.ts#L136 to consider an object as possible value of the property `additionalProperties` and parse the options not included in the `properties` object using its value as definition. 

So, if I create a builder with a schema as follows:

```
 {
  "$schema": "http://json-schema.org/schema",
  "title": "My builder",
  "description": "Executes a command",
  "type": "object",
  "additionalProperties": {
    "type": "string"
  },
  "properties": {
    "command": {
      "type": "string",
      "description": "Command to be executed"
    }
  },
  "required": [
    "command"
  ],
  "definitions": {
  }
}
```

And I pass the following options to the method `parseJsonSchemaToOptions`:

```
['--command', 'my-script', '--foo', 'bar']
```

The method returns the following array:

```
[
 {
   "name": "command",
   "type": "string",
   "required": true,
   "hidden": false
 }
]
``` 

Ignoring the option `--foo`. 

In my option when additionalProperties is an object it should use its value to define the rest of properties returning the following array:

```
[
 {
   "name": "command",
   "type": "string",
   "required": true,
   "hidden": false
 },
 {
   "name": "foo",
   "type": "string",
   "required": false,
   "hidden": false
]
``` 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
If the property `additionalProperties` is set `true` the options not defined explicitly are "stashed" in a property with the name "--" and therefore builders can access to them. 

However, this is not an intuitive workaround and requires the developers to parse these options (split them when using `=` or pair them when using them separately).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "support option passthrough (additionalProperties) in schematics and builders" (#15565)

Issues.Title: Angular Live Development Server is not working
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) ``` - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ x ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ``` ### Is this a regression? I don't think so, It's the first time I see this. ### Description Basically, I run the command `ng serve` and the output in console is correct but when I try to enter in the web site "http://localhost:4200/" It keeps waiting for localhost response forever. There are not message in console and the screen is white. It's strange because five days ago It was working. I have try to reinstall node and angular-cli. Furthermore I have mysql and PHP in localhost running without problems. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Just run `ng serve`. ## üî• Exception or Error 



There is not exception warnings.

    -   [#​9847](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/9847) Remove core-js dependency from [@​babel/register](https://togithub.com/babel/register) ([@​coreyfarrell](https://togithub.com/coreyfarrell))

-   `babel-helper-fixtures`, `babel-helper-transform-fixture-test-runner`, `babel-plugin-proposal-dynamic-import`, `babel-preset-env`
    -   [#​10326](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10326) Allow testing logs with `@babel/helper-transform-fixture-test-runner` ([@​nicolo-ribaudo](https://togithub.com/nicolo-ribaudo))

    -   [#​10331](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10331) Commit generated code ([@​JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))
-   `babel-cli`, `babel-core`, `babel-generator`, `babel-helper-create-class-features-plugin`, `babel-helper-fixtures`, `babel-node`, `babel-parser`, `babel-plugin-proposal-do-expressions`, `babel-plugin-proposal-pipeline-operator`, `babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs`, `babel-plugin-transform-runtime`, `babel-preset-env`, `babel-standalone`, `babel-template`, `babel-traverse`, `babel-types`
    -   [#​10228](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10228) Update dev dependencies and fix linting errors ([@​danez](https://togithub.com/danez))
-   `babel-cli`
    -   [#​10244](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10244) added flow to babel cli ([@​Letladi](https://togithub.com/Letladi))

##### :running_woman: Performance

-   `babel-helpers`, `babel-plugin-transform-modules-commonjs`, `babel-preset-env`
    -   [#​10161](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10161) Improves the logic to import objects in helpers ([@​ifsnow](https://togithub.com/ifsnow))
-   `babel-traverse`
    -   [#​10243](https://togithub.com/babel/babel/pull/10243) perf: always return `void 0` as undefined node ([@​JLHwung](https://togithub.com/JLHwung))

Issues.Title: feat(material/dialog): update dialog subjects to be AsyncSubjects
Issues.Body:
AsyncSubjects have the advantage over other types of Subjects that any subscription made after the subject is marked as complete is still provided with the value.
Specifically for dialogs, this allows the consumer to delay subscribing to the afterClosed observable and still get the result from their dialog.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(material/dialog): update dialog subjects to be AsyncSubjects" (#17057)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental): avoid error when trying to use harness after fixture is destroyed
Issues.Body: Currently before most operations in the harnesses we call `fixture.detectChange`, however doing so on a destroyed fixture throws a vague error. These changes avoid detecting changes on destroyed fixtures.

Issues.Title: Menu mirrors CDK overlay offset
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

If you shift the overlay to not interfere with a titlebar the menu will shift the same amount.  Select, however, works fine.

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ff47mh
 
#### Expected Behavior

I would expect the same behavior for both, ideally the current select behavior which works regardless of an overlay offset.

#### Actual Behavior

Menu is offset by the same amount applied to the CDK overlay.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Menu mirrors CDK overlay offset" (#17049)

Issues.Title: mat-errors that are tied to a custom ErrorStateMatcher aren't triggered when clicking next on mat-horizontal-stepper component
Issues.Body:
<!--------

The Angular team can't provide general troubleshooting help. However, the extended community of
users can provide more help: 

StackOverflow: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/angular-material2
Gitter: https://gitter.im/angular/material2
Google Groups: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/angular-material2

Issues should capture only bug reports and feature requests. However, we understand that 
it is not always clear whether an issue is caused by a bug or incorrect usage of a feature/component.

Most support requests will be automatically closed. If the answer is quickly obvious, though, we 
might be able to provide a brief answer.

-------->


#### What are you trying to do?

Trying to make material stepper perform in linear mode when using controls that have custom validators. In my stackblitz posted below I have 3 controls in a mat step (step 1). I have a custom validation check on 'start date' and 'end date'. The custom validator checks to make sure start date does not exceed 'end date'. There is also a 'required' validator attached to 'end date'. When I click on the header to go to step 2 all the other controls show that they are empty except for 'end date'. I suppose I wanted to start troubleshooting at the most basic level. My initial question is: does 'linear' mode also trigger the display of errors when they are attached to a custom ErrorSateMatcher? In my real world app clicking on the 'next' button behaves the same way. In my stackblitz the 'next' button works for some reason.

#### What troubleshooting steps have you tried?

By default when clicking 'next' in the mat step component the controls are checked for validity and errors are displayed. However I have noticed that my custom controls do not display the errors even when the validity is checked. 

#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-cumv75?file=app/stepper-overview-example.html

#### Environment

- Angular: @angular/core@6.1.10
- CDK/Material: 6.4.7
- Browser(s): Chrome 
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 10]
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-errors that are tied to a custom ErrorStateMatcher aren't triggered when clicking next on mat-horizontal-stepper component" (#17056)

Issues.Body:

I'm trying to contribute with this package, but when setting up the environment as described on DEV_ENVIRONMENT.md, it don't work for a few reasons.

1. The command `yarn dev-app` doesn't exists. The correct command is `yarn demo-app`.
2. There's an error when running it:

```
/home/esoares/Sandbox/material2/node_modules/ts-node/src/index.ts:307

Issues.Title: [CdkVirtualScrollViewport] List on dialog disappears when it is re-opened
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-pzwb1d

Steps to reproduce:

- Click on the 'Show' button and try opening and closing the dialog for a few times.

 
 
#### Expected Behavior

- The list should be displayed at it's scroll position.


#### Actual Behavior

Issues.Title: [Drag&Drop] Use descendants: true when dealing with ContentChildren in most drap&drop directives
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

The change to descendants: true for drag handle in Drag directive was welcoming change. Allow for deeper traversal using descendants:true for other content children also, for example cdkDragPreview and cdkDragPlaceholder.

#### Use Case

Advanced component nesting scenarios are currently blocked or require cumbersome workarounds like slot projections as pictured here https://github.com/angular/components/pull/13360#issuecomment-463137794

When most issues would be solved with deep traversal for content children.

Also, the new policy of locking issues which already cover the topic like here https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13784 does not help the conversation at all.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Drag&Drop] Use descendants: true when dealing with ContentChildren in most drap&drop directives" (#17047)

Issues.Title: Datepicker dates and manually entered dates differs
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-du34ef
https://angular-du34ef.stackblitz.io

Steps to reproduce:
1. Choose a date with the date picker, for example 10th of September 2019. With my locale ('sv'), the selected date will be '2019-09-09T22:00:00.000Z' as presented in the page after selection.
2. Manually enter a date, for example 9th of September 2019. In my test I typed in 2019-09-09 and the selected date became '2019-09-09T00:00:00.000Z'
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

I was expecting that I would get the same selected date no matter selection method. 


#### Actual Behavior

Selecting a date via date picker resulted in a correct UTC-formatted date. But the manually entered date was not correct. It seems like the manually entered is expected to be entered in UTC, not in my current locale.


#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.5
- CDK/Material: 8.1.4
- Browser(s): Firefox, Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Datepicker dates and manually entered dates differs" (#17045)

Issues.Title: Autocomplete closes when scrolling on a touch device
Issues.Body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open https://material.angular.io/components/autocomplete/overview in any touch device
2. Use the example on the page, tap to show autocomplete
3. If it was a longer list or you're viewing on a small device you would want to scroll to see the rest of the list. Scroll with touch.
4. On touchend the autocomplete closes
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

It is the intended behavior according to the code in autcomplete.es5.js L:601
```
return merge(fromEvent(this._document, 'click'), fromEvent(this._document, 'touchend'))`
    .pipe(filter(function (event) {
            /** @type {?} */
            var clickTarget = (/** @type {?} */ (event.target));
            /** @type {?} */
            var formField = _this._formField ?
                _this._formField._elementRef.nativeElement : null;
            return _this._overlayAttached &&
                clickTarget !== _this._element.nativeElement &&
                (!formField || !formField.contains(clickTarget)) &&
                (!!_this._overlayRef && !_this._overlayRef.overlayElement.contains(clickTarget));
        }));
```

The menu closes on touchend but I think it's a bug because it's normal to expect users to scroll on a mobile device to see the rest of the list. I think the `fromEvent(this._document, 'touchend')` should be removed or the code changed to allow scrolling

#### Environment

- Angular: 7.2.13
- CDK/Material: 7.3.7
- Browser(s): All browsers on a touch device
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): All operating systems that support touch
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Autocomplete closes when scrolling on a touch device" (#17039)

Issues.Title: Add scope attribute to headers in DatePicker for improved accessibility
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

The current `<th>`' fields with the days of the week for the material date picker do not have a `scope` attribute. The [scope attribute](https://webaim.org/techniques/tables/data#headers) provides screen readers additional context about which table header is a row or column header. 

Adding `scope='column` for each `<th>` containing a day of the week would improve accessibility for the date picker for those using screen readers.

Current table header code for matDatepicker:

```html
<thead class="mat-calendar-table-header">
<tr>
  <th aria-label="Sunday" class="ng-star-inserted">S</th>
  <th aria-label="Monday" class="ng-star-inserted">M</th>
  <th aria-label="Tuesday" class="ng-star-inserted">T</th>
  <th aria-label="Wednesday" class="ng-star-inserted">W</th>
  <th aria-label="Thursday" class="ng-star-inserted">T</th>
  <th aria-label="Friday" class="ng-star-inserted">F</th>
  <th aria-label="Saturday" class="ng-star-inserted">S</th>
</tr>
</thead>
```

Proposed fix for this code:

```html
<thead class="mat-calendar-table-header">
<tr>
  <th aria-label="Sunday" scope="col" class="ng-star-inserted">S</th>
  <th aria-label="Monday" scope="col" class="ng-star-inserted">M</th>
  <th aria-label="Tuesday" scope="col" class="ng-star-inserted">T</th>
  <th aria-label="Wednesday" scope="col" class="ng-star-inserted">W</th>
  <th aria-label="Thursday" scope="col" class="ng-star-inserted">T</th>
  <th aria-label="Friday" scope="col" class="ng-star-inserted">F</th>
  <th aria-label="Saturday" scope="col" class="ng-star-inserted">S</th>
</tr>
</thead>
```

#### Use Case

All users who interact with matDatepicker via a screen reader would benefit from this change, as the relationship between the day headers and the columns would be made explicit and clear for screen reading tools.

See also https://github.com/angular/components/issues/16317 for other proposed accessibility fixes for this input.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add scope attribute to headers in DatePicker for improved accessibility" (#17038)

Issues.Title: Mat Tab does not work with web components
Issues.Body:
When web components are used in a tab, on switching a tab material removes them from DOM instead of hiding them. 

When web components are removed from DOM, they get destroyed and **lose their state.**
Consequently, switching back to same tab makes them re render again from scratch.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Mat Tab does not work with web components" (#17034)

Issues.Title: build: run custom tslint rules on new packages
Issues.Body:
Apparently we didn't run the custom tslint rules for the new packages
that have been merged (`youtube-player` and `google-maps`). This is
because we have a whitelist of packages we want to run these custom
lint rules against.

It should be actually the other way around where we only specify the folders
we _don't_ want to lint against. That way, new folders are automatically linted
and we need to explicitly exclude them if we don't want to run for those.

**Note**: Marked as target minor because it will not merge safely into the patch branch (as youtube-player is not part of that branch).

I'm not sure if the `module.id` is technically needed for those packages (not sure if they are synced into g3), but we should add them for now to satisfy the `validate-decorators` lint rule. We can remove them as part of the overall cleanup with #13883
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: run custom tslint rules on new packages" (#17033)
